title: 1 shot, child grazed by bullet in Westwood
content:
CINCINNATI —
One person was shot and a girl was grazed by a bullet Friday night in Westwood, police said.
The shooting happened around 8 p.m. at the Tamara Lee Apartments in the 2000 block of Harrison Avenue.
Police said shots were fired in the common area of the apartment complex, which has stairs leading to different units
Officials said that a man was shot in the leg and sent to University of Cincinnati Medical Center. His injuries are not believed to be life-threatening.
In addition, officials said that a girl –- estimated to be between 12 and 13 years old –- was grazed by a bullet. Police said she was taken to Cincinnati Children’s Hospital with a shoulder injury.
Police said they are still investigating what sparked the shooting.
Cincinnati police said they are searching for a single male gunman in connection to the shooting.
